article: On a cold winter day in Denver,I waited in line to see my hero,Jack Canfield,the coauthor of the best--selling Chicken Soup for the Soul series,a/an _ to thousands of people.He was wise,kind and _ ,a visionary for what is possible in the world.I thought, "If I can get to know him,I will become that.'' When I saw the opportunity,I _ it.During his presentation,Jack reached for his wallet, _ out a hundred--dollar bill,and said "Who wants this?" Hands _ up in the audience;people leaned forward to see who Jack would choose.But I leapt up,ran up the stairs to the stage,and grabbed the _ from his hand. As I took the bill,he turned to me and said,"Yes,that's it! We can't _ the opportunities to come to us.We must take action to _ what we want!" After this talk.I waited in _ to meet Jack and asked for his personal e-mail address.Over the next several months,I sent him e-mails _ my vision and dreams.He kindly e-mailed back simple _ such as "Keep thinking and playing bigger;it's much more fun that way.Love,Jack." Then my life got _ with other things.I lost sight of my inspiration and I _ e-mailing Jack. A year later,my dream gradually faded.I had this idea if I got back in touch with Jack.I _ him again and again-but got no _ .As I sat down at my computer to check my email for the fifth time,I _ woke up.What was I doing? Was I waiting for the _ of life? Instantly,an inspiration came like lightning:We all have a "Jack" for whom we _ . Why not write a/an _ about this waiting and call it "Waiting for Jack". Three years later,Waiting for Jack is a best--seller on Amazon! And I have grown in ways I _ expected.
